meanings.definition: The choice, judgment, or control of when something should be done.
meanings.sent1: Her impeccable timing in delivering the punchline always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The timing of the surprise party was perfect; she walked in just as we yelled 'Surprise!'
meanings.sent3: His timing for telling jokes was so bad that people often groaned instead of laughing.
meanings.sent4: The timing of the thunder and lightning was so precise, it felt like nature's own symphony.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's timing was like a well-tuned clock, never missing a beat.

meanings.definition: The ability to select the precise moment for doing something for optimum effect.
meanings.sent1: With perfect timing, she pressed the button right as the fireworks reached their peak.
meanings.sent2: His impeccable timing in negotiations always ensured he got the best deals.
meanings.sent3: The magician's timing was so good that even the rabbit appeared right on cue.
meanings.sent4: The timing of her dance moves was so precise, it mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's timing in jumping over hurdles was flawless, winning him the race.

meanings.definition: The regulation of occurrence, pace, or coordination to achieve a desired effect.
meanings.sent1: The timing of the music in the movie scene heightened the emotional impact.
meanings.sent2: The chef's perfect timing in adding the spices made the dish incredibly flavorful.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's timing was so off that his jokes always fell flat.
meanings.sent4: The timing of the traffic lights seemed to be in sync with her daily commute.
meanings.sent5: The conductor's timing with the orchestra created a magical performance.
